definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Spanish unemployment soared, and the budget went into deep deficit.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙失业率飞速上升，预算陷入深深的赤字之中。

sentences.english: That deficit is not my deficit.
sentences.chinese: 这个赤字不能算成我的赤字。

sentences.english: That deficit is not my deficit.
sentences.chinese: 这个赤字不能算成我的赤字。

sentences.english: Again, I'm not opposed to long-term deficit reduction, so long as it's equitable.
sentences.chinese: 同样，我不反对长期削减赤字，只要它的公平。

sentences.english: If deficits continue, self-governing body may put pressure on the financial situation.
sentences.chinese: 如果赤字继续，可能对自治体的财政状况产生压力。

sentences.english: By 2010, the trade deficit had dropped to $496 billion.
sentences.chinese: 至2010年，贸易赤字已降至4960亿美元。

sentences.english: Letting tax cheats run wild doesn’t exactly serve the cause of deficit reduction.
sentences.chinese: 让骗税泛滥与削减赤字的努力作用刚好相反。

sentences.english: And that we should not worry about the deficit next year or even the year after.
sentences.chinese: 而且我们不应该担心明年或是后年的财政赤字。

sentences.english: King Mswati III's government has admitted it is running out of cash.
sentences.chinese: 姆斯瓦蒂三世国王政府也已承认财政赤字。

sentences.english: The previous year's deficit was $459 billion.
Ricardian Equivalence Rule is an important factor which is used to evaluate fiscal deficit effect.
sentences.chinese: 李嘉图等价定理是评价财政赤字效果的重要因素之一。

sentences.english: The new CFO was sent to bring the company out of the red.
sentences.chinese: 任命新的首席财务官是要把公司从赤字中拯救过来。

sentences.english: The 750 million yuan deficit somehow got rounded up to 800 million yuan.
sentences.chinese: 七亿五千万的赤字莫名其妙地达到了八亿。

sentences.english: Then his finance ministry sent a deficit-reduction plan to the European Commission.
sentences.chinese: 接着他的财政部向欧洲委员会发送了减少赤字的计划。

sentences.english: It’s one of the reasons why we’re working to reduce our nation’s deficit.
sentences.chinese: 我们着力降低国家的赤字，这也是其中的原因之一。

pinyin: e4 xing4 tong1 huo4 peng2 zhang4
